items.question: Are any of the Native American characters actually natives?
items.answer: Some are some are not Native American / First Nation.*Gil (Chief Rainwater) is of Mexican/Comanche heritage. *Kelsey Asbille (Monica Dutton) is of Chinese descent, according to her bio. *Mo Brings Plenty (Mo) is Oglala Lakota. *Atticus Todd Anishinaabe (Ben Waters) is Native but I'm not clear in what tribe. *Tokala Black Elk (Sam Stands Alone) is also Oglala Lakota and has an uncanny resemblance to his Sioux ancestors. *Rudy Ramos (Felix Long) is of Comanche and Kiowa descendant. *Tanaya Beatty (Avery) is half First Nation (Not clear of which tribe) and half Indian (Asian version, not North American) *Martin Sensmeier (Martin) is Tlingit (People of the Tides) of whom are known in the Pacific NorthwestWant to add a little clarity to the muddy H2O: *Heritage is not the correct word. *Ethnicity is more likely the descriptor of most "Native" or whatever moniker currently in vogue term to use. *Mestizo probably describes most accurately "First Nations" in the show, if that.

items.question: Where can I find the music credits for the episodes? Songs, writers, performers.
items.answer: You can purchase the score soundtrack CD by Paramount called: Yellowstone - Original Television Series Soundtrack Music by Brian Tyler.The songs are all listed on Tunefind. Updated by the music supervisor on the show.

items.question: Where is this show filmed?
items.answer: The setting is in Montana where some of the show is filmed however much of the show is filmed on location in Utah.However, due to the pandemic, season 4 was filmed entirely in Montana.

items.question: Where is Yellowstone Ranch located?
items.answer: Somewhere east of Bozeman, Montana. The ranch is in Park County.

items.question: The music keeps reminding me of the music from Victoria, the PBS entry just a few years ago. Drives me to distraction, it's so similar. Anyone else notice this?
items.answer: Not sure exactly what music you're talking about but In S1 E1 the violin playing at the funeral is a tune called Ashokan Farewell. Probably best know from Ken Burns' documentary "The Civil War."

items.question: When will the series be available on Paramount+

spoilerItems.question: Why are some of the ranch workers branded with the Yellowstone logo and others aren't and what does it mean to be branded?
spoilerItems.answer: Those not branded are just hired hands and those branded are former lowlifes who now belong to the ranch even those with the Dutton name. Those with the brand are protected by the Dutton family, not just from those outside the ranch but from disgruntled workers within the ranch.Those who are branded are to live up to the brand. Betraying the ranch has consequences. First the brand is cut off then the transgressor is killed and taken to the Long Black Train.

spoilerItems.question: What is the Train Station?
spoilerItems.answer: Also known as the Long Black Train. It is a rural canyon area south of the Montana-Wyoming border in a county where there is no living person within a hundred miles, no law enforcement, no judge and jury of your peers. It is where the Duttons send their enemies or those who disrespected the ranch to either be killed and/or disposed of into the canyon. It is how Lloyd Pierce put it, how the west was won.
